# üî• Engage ‚Äî The Deepest Hole {.engage-box}

::: {.engage-box}
## The Kola Superdeep Borehole

The deepest hole ever drilled is the **Kola Superdeep Borehole** in Russia ‚Äî 12,262 meters (12.3 km) deep. It took **24 years** (1970‚Äì1994) to drill.

The result? They barely scratched the surface.

**Earth's radius is 6,371 km.** The Kola borehole reached only **0.2%** of the way to the center. It's like scratching the skin of an apple.

So how do we know what's inside Earth if we've never been there?

**The answer: earthquakes.** Every earthquake sends seismic waves through the entire planet. By analyzing how these waves travel, speed up, slow down, bend, and reflect, we can build a detailed picture of Earth's interior ‚Äî like an X-ray of the planet.
:::

# üîç Explore 1 ‚Äî Seismic Waves {.explore-box}

::: {.explore-box}
## Earthquakes as Earth's X-Ray Machine

When an earthquake occurs, it produces two main types of seismic waves that travel through Earth's interior. These waves behave differently depending on what material they pass through.
:::

## P-Waves vs. S-Waves

```{ojs}
//| echo: false
{
```

## Wave Speed Changes with Depth

Seismic wave speeds change as they pass through different materials. Denser materials = faster waves.

```{ojs}
//| echo: false

```

::: {.key-idea}
### üí° How Seismic Waves Reveal Earth's Interior

1. **P-waves drop sharply** at 2,900 km ‚Üí material changes from solid to liquid (mantle ‚Üí outer core)
2. **S-waves disappear entirely** from 2,900 to 5,150 km ‚Üí outer core is **liquid** (S-waves can't travel through liquid)
3. **S-waves reappear** below 5,150 km ‚Üí inner core is **solid** again
4. **Wave speeds increase with depth** in the mantle ‚Üí denser material = faster waves

This is how we know Earth has a liquid outer core and solid inner core ‚Äî without ever going there!
:::

# üí° Explain ‚Äî Earth's Layered Structure {.explain-box}

::: {.explain-box}
## Why Is Earth Layered?

When Earth was young (~4.5 billion years ago), it was almost entirely **molten**. In this liquid state, dense materials (iron, nickel) **sank to the center** while lighter materials (silicon, oxygen, aluminum) **floated to the surface**. This process is called **differentiation**.
:::

# üîç Explore 2 ‚Äî Density and Differentiation {.explore-box}

::: {.explore-box}
## The Density Sorting Experiment

When Earth was molten, gravity sorted materials by density ‚Äî like oil floating on water, but on a planetary scale.
:::

```{ojs}
//| echo: false
viewof showDifferentiation = Inputs.range([0, 100], {
  label: "Time (% through differentiation):",
  step: 1,
  value: 0
})
```

```{ojs}
//| echo: false
{
  const t = showDifferentiation / 100;
  const svg = d3.create("svg")
    .attr("width", 400)
    .attr("height", 400)
    .attr("viewBox", "0 0 400 400");

  const cx = 200, cy = 200;
  
  // Earth circle
  svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 180)
    .attr("fill", "#dfe6e9").attr("stroke", "#636e72").attr("stroke-width", 2);
  
  // Layers appear as differentiation progresses
  if (t > 0.1) {
    const coreR = Math.min(50, t * 55);
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", coreR)
      .attr("fill", "#fdcb6e").attr("opacity", Math.min(1, t * 2));
  }
  if (t > 0.3) {
    const outerCoreR = Math.min(90, 50 + (t - 0.3) * 60);
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", outerCoreR)
      .attr("fill", "#f39c12").attr("opacity", Math.min(1, (t - 0.3) * 2));
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 50)
      .attr("fill", "#fdcb6e");
  }
  if (t > 0.5) {
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 150)
      .attr("fill", "#e17055").attr("opacity", Math.min(1, (t - 0.5) * 2));
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 90)
      .attr("fill", "#f39c12");
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 50)
      .attr("fill", "#fdcb6e");
  }
  if (t > 0.7) {
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 180)
      .attr("fill", "#dfe6e9").attr("opacity", Math.min(1, (t - 0.7) * 3));
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 150)
      .attr("fill", "#e17055");
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 90)
      .attr("fill", "#f39c12");
    svg.append("circle").attr("cx", cx).attr("cy", cy).attr("r", 50)
      .attr("fill", "#fdcb6e");
  }

  // Labels
  const phase = t < 0.1 ? "Homogeneous molten Earth" :
                t < 0.3 ? "Dense iron sinking to center..." :
                t < 0.5 ? "Core forming, outer core separating..." :
                t < 0.7 ? "Mantle solidifying around core..." :
                "Differentiation complete ‚Äî layered Earth!";

  svg.append("text").attr("x", cx).attr("y", 30).attr("text-anchor", "middle")
    .attr("font-size", 14).attr("font-weight", "bold").text(phase);

  if (t > 0.9) {
    const labels = [
      {text: "Crust", y: 30, color: "#636e72"},
      {text: "Mantle", y: 70, color: "#fff"},
      {text: "Outer Core", y: 115, color: "#fff"},
      {text: "Inner Core", y: 200, color: "#636e72"}
    ];
    labels.forEach(l => {
      svg.append("text").attr("x", cx).attr("y", cy - 180 + l.y + 50)
        .attr("text-anchor", "middle").attr("font-size", 11).attr("font-weight", "bold")
        .attr("fill", l.color).text(l.text);
    });
  }

  return svg.node();
}
```

::: {.key-idea}
### üí° Differentiation = Density Sorting

- **Densest** (iron, nickel: ~13 g/cm¬≥) ‚Üí sank to the **core**
- **Medium density** (silicates: ~4-5 g/cm¬≥) ‚Üí formed the **mantle**
- **Least dense** (granite, basalt: ~2.7-3.0 g/cm¬≥) ‚Üí floated to the **crust**

This is the same principle as oil (less dense) floating on water (more dense) ‚Äî just happening at a planetary scale over millions of years while Earth was still molten.
:::

# üî¨ Elaborate ‚Äî The Rock Cycle Revisited {.elaborate-box}

::: {.elaborate-box}
## Connecting the Interior to the Surface

Earth's interior doesn't just sit there ‚Äî it actively drives surface processes through the rock cycle, volcanism, and plate tectonics.
:::

```{ojs}
//| echo: false
{
  const svg = d3.create("svg")
    .attr("width", 700)
    .attr("height", 350)
    .attr("viewBox", "0 0 700 350");

  svg.append("text").attr("x", 350).attr("y", 25).attr("text-anchor", "middle")
    .attr("font-size", 16).attr("font-weight", "bold").text("Interior ‚Üí Surface Connections");

  const connections = [
    {interior: "Mantle convection", surface: "Plate movement", arrow: "Drives", x: 120, color: "#e17055"},
    {interior: "Magma rising", surface: "Volcanic eruptions", arrow: "Creates", x: 300, color: "#d63031"},
    {interior: "Plate stress", surface: "Earthquakes", arrow: "Releases", x: 480, color: "#6c5ce7"},
    {interior: "Core convection", surface: "Magnetic field", arrow: "Generates", x: 620, color: "#f39c12"}
  ];

  connections.forEach(c => {
    // Interior box
    svg.append("rect").attr("x", c.x - 65).attr("y", 50).attr("width", 130).attr("height", 60)
      .attr("rx", 10).attr("fill", c.color).attr("opacity", 0.85);
    const iLines = c.interior.split(" ");
    iLines.forEach((line, i) => {
      svg.append("text").attr("x", c.x).attr("y", 75 + i * 16).attr("text-anchor", "middle")
        .attr("font-size", 11).attr("font-weight", "bold").attr("fill", "white").text(line);
    });

    // Arrow
    svg.append("text").attr("x", c.x).attr("y", 140).attr("text-anchor", "middle")
      .attr("font-size", 22).text("‚¨áÔ∏è");
    svg.append("text").attr("x", c.x).attr("y", 165).attr("text-anchor", "middle")
      .attr("font-size", 10).attr("fill", "#636e72").attr("font-weight", "bold").text(c.arrow);

    // Surface box
    svg.append("rect").attr("x", c.x - 65).attr("y", 180).attr("width", 130).attr("height", 60)
      .attr("rx", 10).attr("fill", c.color).attr("opacity", 0.3);
    const sLines = c.surface.split(" ");
    sLines.forEach((line, i) => {
      svg.append("text").attr("x", c.x).attr("y", 205 + i * 16).attr("text-anchor", "middle")
        .attr("font-size", 11).attr("font-weight", "bold").text(line);
    });
  });

  // Section labels
  svg.append("text").attr("x", 20).attr("y", 85).attr("font-size", 12).attr("font-weight", "bold")
    .attr("fill", "#636e72").text("DEEP");
  svg.append("text").attr("x", 20).attr("y", 215).attr("font-size", 12).attr("font-weight", "bold")
    .attr("fill", "#636e72").text("SURFACE");

  return svg.node();
}
```
